poem:
Title: Iron Rain on Icarus' Wing 

Oh, the ship of Open Arms sails,
Behold! Under the tyrant sun's gaze.
Wearied by the dance of war's regales,
Hope's vessel embarked from Cyprus' bays.

Yet the vulture's song did echo,
In Gaza, Tel Aviv, Beirut below.
Where the innocent seek God's clemency,
Yet find man-made thunder in their plea.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. We will be closing this blog soon, but you can stay up to date on the Guardian’s Middle East coverage here. Here is a recap of the latest developments: The aid ship, the Spanish-flagged Open Arms, which left Cyprus yesterday, is". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
